attributes.action: placental abruption awareness in ante natal clinics
attributes.additional_details:
Every ante natal clinic should have an information leaflet describing the signs, symptoms and advice on the condition placental abruption, also known as placentae abruptio, a condition which unfortunately people only learn about after it has happened.
in brief, during pregnancy the placenta detaches from the uterine wall causing a lack of oxygen to the unvborn baby, it is a potentially life threatening condition to both mother and unborn. There are 2 types of the condition: internal or concealed p.a. and external p.a. both of which are equally as bad.
As a mother of  5,having had 2 normal and healthy pregnancies i went on to have an external p.a. with my 3rd child, then a internal p.a. with my 4th. i then had a normal pregnancy with my 5th and have had several tests both antenatal and postnatal and there is no reasons why.
The most important thing is TIME.....
